Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The subject property is located in Tullos, a predominantly industrial sector of the City of Aberdeen approximately 3 miles south of the City Centre. The branch benefits from a highly prominent and visible corner position on the corner of Greenwell Road and the much busier arterial route of Wellington Road (A956). The building is on the periphery of nearby East Tullos & West Tullos Industrial Estates home to a vast number of businesses predominantly associated with the Oil & Gas industry. In recent years Wellington Road, as a main arterial route connecting the south and north of the City, has become popular with car showrooms, drive thru’s and other roadside occupiers.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property comprises a standalone single storey building on a regularly shaped and proportioned site of approximately 0.5 acre. The property is of concrete construction with a flat roof estimated to have been constructed in the 1970’s with the Bank of Scotland in continuous occupation since 1974. In addition to the building itself there is a small private car park providing dedicated car parking for approximately 10-15 vehicles. The bank also has 'rights' over a separate adjacent area of ground currently utilised as landscaping which extends to 0.47 acres. Under the terms of the lease this area is only permitted to be used for 'amenity' use.

Rent
The current passing rent of the property is £10,600 per annum.

Terms
The property is held by way of a 99 year ‘long leasehold expiring on 31st July 2072.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £28,750.00 and the rates payable are £14,087.50 pa. The UBR for 2021/2022 is 49p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Aberdeen is Scotland's

Union Street is the prime retail thoroughfare in Aberdeen City Centre and the subject property is located at the Western End of the Street close to the prominent Holburn junction so benefits from a high volume of footfall and passing trade.

There is an attractive mix of local and national occupiers including Tesco Express, Greggs, Cafe Nero and Sainsburys Local.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property comprises a double fronted ground floor retail unit forming part of 'Holburn House', a 1980's constructed five storey office building, which is currently undergoing a comprehensive refurbishment programme. The unit is highly prominent with a near 20ft frontage onto Union Street.

Accommodation is arranged over ground floor only with an open plan retail sales area and counter. Customer toilets and staff facilities are also provided.

Energy Efficiency Rating is G.

Energy Perfomance Certificate available on request.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 1st March 2026.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease for a minimum termof 5 years.

Rent
£58,750 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £53,000.00 and the rates payable are £27,083.00 pa. The UBR for 2020/2021 is 51.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Next door to the majestic Silver Fin Building, 461 Union Street benefits from all the local amenities that you might expect when situated on Aberdeen's main retail thoroughfare.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Energy Efficiency Rating is G.

Energy Performance Certificate is available on request.

Tenure
The property is available on the basis of a FRI lease for a negotiable period.

Rates
An estimate of Rateable Value and rates payable can be provided.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The subjects are situated on a prominent corner site on the north side of Union Street, Aberdeen’s main commercial thoroughfare, at the junction with Belmont Street, another well-known pedestrianised street in the city centre. The subjects are situated directly across from All Saints and Primark with other retail occupiers in the vicinity including Barclays, Millets, Boots, Nationwide, HMV, Beaverbrooks and McDonald’s. Belmont Street is popular with both local and national pub and nightclub operators, with surrounding occupiers including Slains Castle, The Hogshead, The Wild Boar, Revolution, Revolucion de Cuba and Siberia.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subjects comprise the ground floor and basement within a four storey and attic traditional granite building. The subjects benefit from a corner entrance and large, return window frontage with attractive banded piers. The accommodation provides an open plan sales area on the ground floor with storage and ancillary accommodation in the basement.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £47,000.00 and the rates payable are £23,406.00 pa. The UBR for 2021/2022 is 49.80p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Overlooks The Popular Union Terrace Gardens

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subjects are located midway along the west side of Union Terrace, within the heart of Aberdeen city centre.

Union Street, which runs perpendicular to Union Terrace, is Aberdeen’s principal commercial thoroughfare. The surrounding premises are given over a mixture of retail, office and leisure uses. Nearby occupiers include LR Senergy, Mott MacDonald, Worley Parsons, Hays Recruitment, His Majesty’s Theatre, Chaophraya Restaurant and The Caledonian Hotel.

The property overlooks the popular Union Terrace Gardens with rail and bus stations also within a short walking distance.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subjects are arranged over the basement, ground, first, second and third floors of a four storey and basement building, and the ground, first and second floors of an attractive three storey traditional granite
building with centre balcony.

Currently, the fit out is typical of a corporate bank. The ground floor accommodation comprises a main banking hall and customer waiting area as well as individual meeting rooms. The ground floor
accommodation as well as the private banking area located on the first floor have recently been refurbished.

The majority of the first floor is a void over the banking hall. A large boardroom which retains traditional features, a private banking lounge and individual office are located on the remainder of the first floor.

The second floor provides further cellular office accommodation and male and female WCs. The top floor is used for staff ancillary accommodation including kitchen facilities and break out area.

The subjects benefit from a lift which provides access to all floors of the building except the basement. There is also a traditional staircase running the height of the building.

Energy Efficiency Rating is D.

Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Terms
The property is held on a full repairing and insuring lease expiring 23rd June
2021. The current rent is £145,000 p.a. exclusive of VAT, subject to a final
upwards only rent review on 24th June 2016.

Our client is seeking to assign their leasehold interest, although may consider sub-leasing.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £132,000 and the rates payable are £69,168pa. The UBR for 2020/2021 is 52.4p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The subjects are located on the west side of Shiprow close to its junction with Exchequer Row and approximately 50m south of Union Street, the city’s main commercial thoroughfare, and 250m east of Market Street. The subjects are well positioned for easy access as the city’s bus and train stations are located only a short distance away and parking is available at the adjacent NCP car park. Surrounding occupiers include a mix of office, retail and leisure use including Maersk FPSO, R2S and Clarksons Shipping in the adjacent City Wharf office development and Vue Cinema, Lane 7 Bowling, Pure Gym, Ibis, Miller & Carter, Brewdog, Fierce Beer, G Casino, Aberdeen Maritime Museum as well as Costa, Prezzo, All Bar One, Tony Macaroni, Mackies 19.2 Ice Cream Parlour and Residence Inn by Marriot in the nearby Marischal Square office and leisure development on Broad Street.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subjects comprise the ground and first floor of a 3 storey building in the
south section of a purpose built leisure complex constructed in approximately 2001. The lower ground floor has been recently fitted out as a bar with bowling alley with the northern section, which is arranged over 4 floors, housing the Vue Cinema.

Terms
The accommodation is available to lease on new Full Repairing and Insuring
terms for a period to be agreed. Regular rent reviews will be incorporated for medium and long term leases.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £ and the rates payable are £50,000.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Aberdeen is Scotland's third largest city and is the major retail and administrative hub for the North East of Scotland, with a shopping catchment of in excess of 400,000 people.

The subjects occupy a prominent position overlooking Shiprow, which connects to Trinity Quay at Aberdeen Harbour to the south and to Union Street to the north within the heart of Aberdeen City Centre.

Aberdeen train station, main bus terminus and Union Square and Bon Accord/St Nicholas Shopping Centre are all within a short walking distance of the subjects.

Nearby commercial occupiers include IBIS Hotel, Pure Gym, Lane 7, Grosvenor Casino and a 7 screen Vue Cinema.  An NCP multi level car park is located adjacent.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
City Wharf is a prime leisure destination offering open plan space to let in various configurations which the agents would be delighted to discuss in more detail.

Subject to consents, the available space is suitable for use as retail or licensed/leisure.

Units will be handed over in developers shell specification with capped services.

Unit          Size                 Rent psf      Quoting Rent

Unit C       6,146 sq ft        £7.50             £46,000 pa

Unit D       3,348 sq ft        £7.50             £25,000 pa

Unit C&D   9,494 sq ft        £7.10             £67,500 pa

Rates
Still to be assessed.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Aberdeen is Scotland's third largest city and benefits from a thriving energy sector, comfortably sitting within the top 25 retail locations in the UK. The city's resident population draws on a substantial catchment in the region of 500,000. There are also two universities with an estimated student population of approximately 30,000.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Energy Efficiency Rating is G.

Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Rent
£7,750 per annum.

Terms
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 27th October 2022.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease for a minimum term of 5 years.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £8,100.00 and the rates payable are £4,033.80 pa. The UBR for 2020/2021 is 49.8p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.
